result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan A Segebrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan A Segebrecht is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan A Segebrecht was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(i).
  • Nathan A Segebrecht was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM Defendant Nathan A Segebrecht in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Nathan A Segebrecht.  Attorney Robin W Lee in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2, 4.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 1, 3, 5  . 



COUNT 2    
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve  10 months  in the DCJ, with Huber cc to 20CF1542

-Stayed for 3 years probation cc to 20CF1542

COUNT 4    
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve  9 months   in the DCJ, with Huber cc to 20CF1542 and count 2


-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to 20CF1542, and count 2


CONDITIONS:
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Defendant not to use or possess any weapon 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose
-Early discharge at 2 years, with agent approval
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 

COURT COSTS:
Ct 2, 4
-DNA surcharge waived
-All CC, DNA surcharge waived. VW surcharge due on probation. 

-Days credit for time served:  33 days
-Days credit if revoked: 33 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

kthies  minutes emailed to DOC
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathan A Segebrecht
Current: 102 Buechner Cir, Mount Horeb, WI 53572 United States  (Effective: 09-01-2022)
Prior: DCJ,
Request for Plea/Sentencing Hearing- Atty Idlas

9:13 AM Defendant Nathan A Segebrecht in court.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Nathan A Segebrecht.  Prosecuting attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer tendered, defense will inform court in 3 days what to set for.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

09:44 AM Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State called first witness. State moved for finding of transactional relation between Counts 1, 2, & 5. Court made finding. State called first witness. Officer DerManuelian duly sworn & testified. Direct by State. Cross by defense. State moved for bind over. Objection by defense. Court granted motion to bind over.

02:00 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom.
